completed until the mid-1960s , the arch today attracts million of tourist annually and is one of the world 's most widely recognized structure .", 'By weaving together social , political , and cultural history , historian Tracy Campbell uncovers the complicated and troubling history of the beloved structure .', 'This compelling book explores how a medley of player with widely divergent motivation ( civic pride , ambition , greed , among others ) brought the Gateway Arch to fruition , but at a price the city continues to pay .', 'Campbell dispels long-held myth and casts a provocative new light on the true origin and meaning of the Gateway Arch .', 'He shows that the monument was the scheme of shrewd city leader who sought to renew downtown St. Louis and were willing to steal an election , destroy historic building , and drive out local people and business to achieve their goal .', 'Campbell also tells the human story of the architect Eero Saarinen , whose planning and the debacle of 1976 .', "In 1682 , 1776 , or 1876 , the optimism of Edmund Bacon 's remarkable 1959 vision for Philadelphia 's future- '' Philadelphia in the Year 2009 '' -would have surprised no one .", "From its founding , Philadelphia 's unfolding future were consistently dynamic , focusing the energy of colonial expansion , democratic governance , and industrialization in one urban crucible .", 'No other city in America exhibited each trend so dramatically .', 'It was the Centennial Exhibition in Philadelphia in 1876- with the glass and steel dome of its Memorial Hall , its display of telegraphy and the telephone , its prototype steam automobiles-that first demonstrated to Americans what an industrialized nation might really look like .', "Ed Bacon was an enthusiast of world 's fair and public exhibition , writing and speaking of them throughout his career to illustrate and promote trend in urban development , and working in the genre himself to advance a far-reaching planning agenda for Philadelphia in the postwar decade .", 'Philadelphia emerged from World War II burdened by creaking infrastructure and a housing shortage , its Center City business district underperforming against rival city .', "Deindustrialization was already noticeable by the mid-1950s , an emerging economic reality that foretold difficulty in achieving the social goal of a new and aggressive generation of reform-minded political leadership.1 Resident were embarking for the suburbs at a steady clip , with the city falling by 1960 from third to fourth in population behind Los Angeles.2 Bacon 's 50-year vision projected against this backdrop might have struck the reader as cheerful but unrealistic , even naïve .", 'But what good is a prophecy if it does not reveal a hidden future , a future obstructed ?', "Bacon 's future was a city revitalized , beautified , and modernized in time to host the nation 's Bicentennial celebration and a simultaneous 1976 Philadelphia World 's Fair .", "Imaginative planning was his method , enabling the political gatekeeper along with the citizen of the city to see with him decade ahead and to grasp the occasion of a fair to accomplish lasting change for the city 's built environment and its people .", "`` Philadelphia in the Year 2009 '' builds its case on this one powerful idea : A world 's fair could transform it into a model of humane urbanism.3 Considering his vantage point in 1959 , it is possible to imagine why Ed Bacon might predict the future of Philadelphia with such mesmerizing flourish .", 'The Philadelphia City Planning Commission ( PCPC ) , under his directorship , was in the midst of one of the longest winning streak any urban planning body had or has ever achieved .', 'With Penn Center , Society Hill , Independence Mall , the neighborhood of Eastwick and the Far Northeast each underway or finished , Bacon and his team of young planner were totally in their stride in 1959 , working to think , dig , and build the city out of its rut .', "The Market East transportation center , a pedestrian-friendly Chestnut Street , and a tourist-friendly Delaware waterfront were all on Bacon 's drawing board , too .", 'These were the varied piece , described in turn by each of the author in this volume , of a full urban-renewal portfolio advanced consistently over more than two decade by the PCPC .', "Postwar federal legislation enabled city official for the first time to broadly exercise eminent domain power , moving mass of resident and bulldozing whole section of the city , planning and building anew.4 Ed Bacon 's PCPC was certainly of its time in this respect and forceful in its place , stirring up both wonder and backlash .", 'The old industrial city , the city that had lain fallow through the Depression and World War II , was awakening slowly to the possibility of highrises and integrated transportation hub , and at the same time rediscovering its walkable character and the vernacular beauty of its historic neighborhood .', "Bacon 's idea was to liberate William Penn 's grid from over a century of industrial-age clutter and to make the city simultaneously auto- , pedestrian- , and investment-friendly .", 'Bacon understood the power of display and salesmanship as key to making his idea of the next Philadelphia into something tangible .', "In this spirit , his `` 2009 '' essay arrived on newsstand in 1959 .", 'Could new high-rise and a suburban-style shopping center downtown reverse massive job loss and a suburban exodus ?', "Whether the PCPC 's project were comprehensive enough remained an open question in 1959 .", "In this context , the Philadelphia World 's Fair could provide a shared goal , a focused way for Bacon to complete the project he wanted .", "Market East , the Chestnut Street pedestrian mall , and even the heliport and Kabuki dancer really pale in comparison , though , to his essay 's boldest claim .", 'In 2009 Philadelphia will not have any bad neighborhood , suburbanite will have moved back bringing their vitality and tax dollar with them , greenway will ring the city , transportation option will be rational and varied ; the entire metropolis will reflect the best and brightest idea that modern urban planning can deliver .', "Bacon 's prediction still astound with their self-confidence , and throughout the 1960s and into the 1970s , from City Hall to the hall of academia and elite architecture firm and banker ' office , from newsroom to neighborhood across the city , Philadelphians would grapple with the idea that a world 's fair could help deliver the future city they desired .", 'This chapter examines the fair-as-urban renewal formula that Ed Bacon worked with to promote his long-range planning objective in Philadelphia .', "The `` 2009 '' essay was just one of the many publication and speech he used to stimulate and sustain interest in the manifold project of the PCPC .", 'But here was a truly seductive model of development .', "If a world 's fair could leave useful permanent structure behind while simultaneously rejuvenating public faith in the city , then what was the downside ?", 'Ed Bacon and score of Philadelphians would take up this challenge , shaping it over a 15-year period to fit their own vision for the future of their city .', "From London 's 1851 Crystal Palace Exhibition to New York 's 1939 World 's Fair , such event periodically announced new era in technology and science , in business , and in culture .", 'As Bacon and other key player in Philadelphia intuited , they also offered host city opportunities to innovate in urban design .', "Starting with Brussels in 1958 a new generation of postwar world 's fair began , and the planning for the Philadelphia Fair took place as fair were held in Seattle ( 1962 ) , New York ( 1964 ) , Montreal ( 1967 ) , San Antonio ( 1968 ) , and Osaka ( 1970 ) .", 'The difficulty of the New York Fair and the success of the Montreal one especially played defining role as the Philadelphia planning process went forward .', "Learning and applying lesson from fair in other city and other era proved difficult for Philadelphia 's planner .", 'The chapter develops two main analytical point .', "First , world 's fair have historically proven as different and mercurial as the city and time period of their creation , and have rarely inspired large-scale urban renewal in host city in predictable , linear way .", "The historical lesson and legacy of world 's fair for urban planner were ( and remain ) decidedly ambiguous .", 'But by studying the period of gestation for a fair , and perhaps by extension any large-scale civic undertaking , we gain critical insight into the dominant conflict shaping the modern city .', "As the planning process moved into the 1960s and early 1970s , it became more and more evident that the Philadelphia World 's Fair of 1976-if it was to happen-would not recreate the 1876 Centennial Exhibition or launch an urban renaissance so much as reflect the clashing ambition of citizen caught in a declining American industrial metropolis .", "The final plan , to the extent there ever was one plan , deviated starkly in both intention and design from Bacon 's 1959 vision .", 'This leads to the second point .', "The deviation from Bacon 's `` 2009 '' vision shows two quite specific urban historical process working in conjunction : The decline of the `` master planner '' and by extension New Deal/Great Society urban liberalism , and the rise of a consensus-seeking planning model driven by the maturation of urban community-based protest movement .", "The evolving plan for the World 's Fair vividly show these trend defining one another , with plan for ( and protest against ) the Fair emerging from all quarter of the city , diluting the strength of Bacon 's 1959 vision , while at the same time adding element more desirable , more democratic , to the multiple community affected .", 'Between 1970 and 1972 planning for the Fair broke apart amid a prolonged season of racial strife , intergenerational resentment , federal disinvestment , and a creeping urban pessimism .', 'Combined with hesitant municipal leadership this climate of urban uncertainty clouded the vision of a fair-as-catalyst to a utopian `` Philadelphia in the Year 2009 .', ''", "This influx of visitor and national culture also opened Philadelphia andthe United States to a world of new influence ; the Japanese exhibit in particular stirred an Oriental design fashion in among previously divided elite and marked the ascendance of a Republican hegemony in local political culture that would be virtually unchallenged for the next sixty year .', "The Republican regime that coalesced in the 1870s combined several element : party bossism centered in control of several city agency , an electoral machine that came to trade vote for public construction contract ,
